summary: This bill, the ABC-ED Act of 2025, amends the Public Health Service Act to allow public health data modernization grants to track hospital bed capacity. It mandates the development of real-time, state- or region-wide systems to monitor bed availability and related factors like emergency department boarding rates and wait times. It also includes provisions for a pilot program related to geriatric and psychiatric emergency care improvements. Additionally, it requires the Comptroller General to study best practices for public health data systems tracking hospital capacity and report findings to Congress.
